conclusion: To determine if the difference in displacement is continuously increasing, analyze the v-t graphs.
The area under a v-t graph represents displacement.
For object A, the area under the curve from 0 to t1 is larger than for object B.
Object A has a greater displacement over the time interval from 0 to t1.
Displacement of each object is found by calculating the area under each curve from 0 to t1.
Let Δx_A be the displacement of object A and Δx_B be the displacement of object B.
The difference in displacement is given by Δx_A - Δx_B.
Object A starts with a higher velocity than object B and maintains it throughout the interval.
The rate at which object A is moving away from object B is always positive.
The displacement of object A is always increasing faster than that of object B.
The difference in displacement Δx_A - Δx_B is continuously increasing over the interval.
The difference in displacement between the two objects is necessarily continuously increasing.
